title: //<![CDATA[ GMB's Richard Madeley sparks divide after asking if tornado victims 'have got over it' //]]>
text:
Richard Madeley asks if tornado victims have 'got over it'
[Richard Madeley](/latest/richard-madeley) sparked a divided response from [Good Morning Britain](/latest/good-morning-britain) viewers on Friday after he asked if the Manchester tornado victims had "got over it". It comes after the residents of Stalybridge in Greater Manchester continued a clean-up operation after Storm Gerrit saw a tornado tear off roofs.
Thousands of homes also went a second night without power in the wake of the storm. Introducing the update, Richard told
[ITV](/latest/itv) viewers: "About 100 homes were damaged and a major incident was declared by the police.
"Katy Rickitt is in Stalybridge for us. Well, how are they managing up there now Katy?
"It's been a day or so now, are they getting over it?"
"Well I think there's going to be quite a lot of work to be done to get over this one," Katy responded.
The presenter continued: "As you say - a tornado, you never expect it in the UK.
"It's the sort of thing you hear about in America but this hit here in Stalybridge.
"About 100 houses, a very localised area. You can see the houses behind me, all ready for Christmas, the trees are up.

"And then look, this tornado came in and ripped the roofs clean off."
Taking to X, some viewers complained about Richard's question.
@Roy_the_boyo fumed: "Madeley /partridge comment about hurricane victims 'they will get over it' what a k***head #gmb."
@allen_rob penned: "Richard Madeley is an absolute wage stealer and a clown. What does ITV see, that the rest of nation doesn't??? #GMB."
@wrinklytimelord added: "Still gobsmacked at Madeley's 'They'll get over it' remark about the people whose homes were wrecked by the tornadoes in Manchester #GMB."
"#gmb Will Muppet madeley tell us about his tornado experience?" asked @buncie44.
@PERSIMONE shared: "Yeah @richardm56, they'll get over it after all it’s only a roof thorn off U utter p**** #gmb."
However, some defended Richard later in the show when he got involved in a debate about whether all teachers need a maths GCSE.
@grahamchatterl2 commented: "I mean the whole thing is utter nonsense and retention is the real issue and the maths thing is a minor issue. But it’s not often I agree with Richard Madeley so I thought I’d share."
Good Morning Britain airs weekdays from 6am on ITV.
